meanings.definition: Used to indicate the sound of a sudden impact or collision.
meanings.sent2: Oh, whammo! I didn't expect that loud noise.
meanings.sent3: When the cat knocked over the vase, it went whammo on the floor.
meanings.sent4: The thunder hit the ground like a whammo during the storm.
meanings.sent5: The whammo of the car crash echoed through the street.

meanings.definition: An exclamation used to express surprise or excitement.
meanings.sent1: Whammo! That magic trick was amazing!
meanings.sent2: Wow, whammo! I can't believe you won the game.
meanings.sent3: When the surprise party started, everyone shouted whammo!
meanings.sent4: Her smile hit me like a whammo of happiness.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks lit up the sky with a whammo of color.

meanings.definition: To strike or hit with great force.
meanings.sent1: He whammoed the ball out of the park.
meanings.sent2: The hammer whammoed the nail into the wood.
meanings.sent3: She whammoed the pinata so hard, the candy flew everywhere.
meanings.sent4: The boxer's punch whammoed his opponent to the ground.
meanings.sent5: The strong wind whammoed the door shut.
